lines.gurmukhi: Elw brKn krKn dwmnI bXwir swgr lhir bn jrq Agin hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aolaa Barakhan Karakhan Daamanee Bayaari , Saagar Lahari Ban Jarat Agani Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If hails be falling, lightening be making thunderous sounds, storm be raging. stormy waves be rising in the ocean and forests may be burning with fire;

lines.gurmukhi: rwjI ibrwjI BUkMpkw AMqr biRQw bl bMdswl swsnw sMkt mY mgnu hY
lines.transliteration_english: Raajee Biraajee Bhookanpakaa Antar Bridaa Bala , Bandasaal Saasanaa Sankat Mai Maganu Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The subjects be without their king, earthquakes be experienced, one may have been troubled by some deep innate pain and for some offence may have been lodged in the jail;

lines.gurmukhi: Awpdw ADIn dIn dUKnw dirdR iCdiR BRmiq audws irn dwsin ngn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapadaa Adheen Deen Dookhanaa Daridr Chhidri , Bhramati Udaas Rin Daasani Nagan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Many tribulations may overpower him, may be distressed by false accusations, poverty may have crushed him, may be wandering for loan and caught in the slavery, may be straying aimlessly but in acute hunger;

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI siRsit ko AdiRstu jau Awie lwgY jg mY Bgqn ky rom n Bgn hY ]403]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Srisati Ko Adrisatu Jau Aai Laagai , Jag Mai Bhagatan Kay Rom N Bhagan Hai ?403?

Shabad OS B.translation: And even if more of such worldly tribulations and distresses may befall upon Guru-loving, obedient and meditating persons dear to the True Guru, they are least troubled by them and live life ever in bloom and happiness.  (403)
